property.name: text
property.value: Set ID to be <your team ID> Set initial position and speed

property.name: text
property.value: Every second, trigger a read from the key-value store. The trigger input ensures that this occurs after the write that occurs at the same time.

property.name: text
property.value: A robot that moves towards the last known position of an intruder.

property.name: script
description
property.value:
This accessor reads or writes data to a key-value store web service. The key and the value are both encoded using the JavaScript encodeURIComponent() function, and on retrieval, decoded using decodeURIComponent(). If remove is true and the key is non-empty, then upon firing, this actor will remove the specified key from the store, producing on its output the previous value (if any).

This accessor assumes that the protocol implemented at that location matches the specification below for the default location:

  • To store a value with key MY_ID and value MY_VALUE, use 
       http://ptango.eecs.berkeley.edu:8077/keyvalue/set?id=MY_ID&value=MY_VALUE
  • To retrieve the value, use 
       http://ptango.eecs.berkeley.edu:8077/keyvalue/get?id=MY_ID
  • To remove a value, use 
       http://ptango.eecs.berkeley.edu:8077/keyvalue/delete?id=MY_ID
  • To list all keys (a JSON array of strings), use 
       http://ptango.eecs.berkeley.edu:8077/keyvalue/list

    • A Ptolemy II model that provides such a key-value store service is provided at http://terraswarm.org/accessors/demo/KeyValueStore/KeyValueStore.xml. A demo client that uses this accessor is provided at http://terraswarm.org/accessors/demo/KeyValueStore/KeyValueStoreClient.xml.

property.name: key (port-parameter)
property.value: Key to be updated or retrieved.

property.name: remove (port-parameter)
property.value: If true, then remove the key from the store; otherwise, retrieve the value for the key.

property.name: value (port-parameter)
property.value: Value to store in the key-value store, or empty to not store anything.

property.name: result (port)
property.value: Value retrieved from or written to the key-value store.

This accessor assumes that the protocol implemented at that location matches the specification below for the default location:

  • To list all keys (a JSON array of strings), use

property.value: Value retrieved from or written to the key-value store.
